revised_title: Sodium Extrusion Energy Requirements in Frog Muscles
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the energy required for sodium extrusion from frog muscles. They measured the oxygen consumption and sodium efflux in frog sartorius muscles and found that about one-tenth of the energy from resting metabolism was used for active sodium extrusion. This study provides insights into muscle physiology and ion transport mechanisms.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
